data.text: I've done trailer camping, but it was 100% off road, and all I'll say is never again. Granted it was pre-smartphones, ebikes, navigation etc. The problem with the trailer is that it goes against the basic strategy of: Lay out what you want to take, and then delete half. Lay that new loadout out, and delete half again. The trailer was too heavy and getting it through "motorized vehicle restrictor gates" was next stupid, and if you had to be on the road with no shoulder....lets just say that the only time it was convenient is when you sat down to eat or sleep, there was a lot of creature comforts present. But gear has changed, weighs have drastically improved, and although the trailer format works if you have kids or dogs or both in-tow, that's about the only reasonable justification to do it....solo it doesn't make a whole lot of sense compared to a normal touring layout where you can get 85% of what you're carrying on a trailer in and on top of panniers...and it's a heck of a lot easier to deal with in practically every situation. But to each their own....I'm not an e-bike guy either..

data.text: My entire sleep system is here: Tent, poles, pegs, sleeping bag, sleeping bag liner and pillow, air mattress and air mattress pump (sea to summit pump bag).
